title: Ontology-Based Search System Utilization for Strengthening Action Research Literature Processing Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic academic search skills, comprehension of action research concepts
context.additional_context: A course designed to effectively process and integrate behavioral research literature in smartphone-based online environments.

learning_goals: Learners can identify action research core concepts (constructs, causal relationships) with 85% accuracy using an ontology-based search system.
Learners acquire the ability to visually map relationships between diverse theories and apply them to research framework design.
Compared to existing search systems, learners achieve a 40% reduction in false positive rates and a 30% improvement in integrated theory efficiency.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
